alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 5:46PM EDT until May 06 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Northeast Kentucky and South Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Northeast Kentucky, Lewis. In South Central Ohio, Scioto. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 546 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Portsmouth, Wheelersburg, New Boston, Vanceburg, Greenup, South Webster, Camp Dix, Rosemount, Franklin Furnace, Sciotodale, Tollesboro, Garrison, Buena Vista in Scioto County, Rexton, Tannery, Saint Paul, Friendship, Turkey Creek Lake, Firebrick and Kinniconick.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
